text: I grew up in the Bill Nighy generation
so seeing the experiments being done in
learning science from demonstrations
that are very tactile and visual was
something that was very familiar to me
in high school biology and art were my
two favorite subjects and my degree is
in medical illustrations so I had half
my classes were science classes and half
our art classes we did cadaver
dissection and then we drew from it and
it was a real mixture of the science and
the art and and the best way to
communicate things and a lot of
illustration classes that were
non-medical because that teaches you
storytelling and Composition science
just excites me and I like being in a
position to teach it to others to
communicate it to others when I found
out about this profession it just
clicked so I went with it
and I'm glad that I did
you
